---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [22a400ff84](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13902/commits/22a400ff84cfddf9de22da9ec9d3732756b31903)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.TwoSidedIdeal.Basic`|560|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ TwoSidedIdeal`
`+ addCommGroup`
`+ add_mem`
`+ coeOrderEmbedding`
`+ ext`
`+ instance : Add I where add x y := ‚ü®x.1 + y.1, I.add_mem x.2 y.2‚ü©`
`+ instance : AddSubgroupClass (TwoSidedIdeal R) R`
`+ instance : Neg I where neg x := ‚ü®-x.1, I.neg_mem x.2‚ü©`
`+ instance : SMul ‚Ñï I where smul n x := ‚ü®n ‚Ä¢ x.1, I.nsmul_mem n x.2‚ü©`
`+ instance : SMul ‚Ñ§ I where smul n x := ‚ü®n ‚Ä¢ x.1, I.zsmul_mem n x.2‚ü©`
`+ instance : SMulMemClass (TwoSidedIdeal R) R R`
`+ instance : SMulMemClass (TwoSidedIdeal R) R·µê·µí·µñ R`
`+ instance : Sub I where sub x y := ‚ü®x.1 - y.1, I.sub_mem x.2 y.2‚ü©`
`+ instance : Zero I where zero := ‚ü®0, I.zero_mem‚ü©`
`+ le_iff`
`+ lt_iff`
`+ mem_iff`
`+ mem_mk'`
`+ mk'`
`+ mul_mem_left`
`+ mul_mem_right`
`+ neg_mem`
`+ nsmul_mem`
`+ rel_iff`
`+ setLike`
`+ sub_mem`
`+ zero_mem`
`+ zsmul_mem`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
How do we feel about having `abbrev TwoSidedIdeal := RingCon`? I don't love the spelling `RingCon`.

> How do we feel about having `abbrev TwoSidedIdeal := RingCon`? I don't love the spelling `RingCon`.

I have added the abbreviation `TwoSidedIdeal`. I also moved the file to `TwosidedIdeal/Basic.lean` since I think this file will grow very long otherwise. See if you like it better now @j-loreaux

> We're going to have to lose this at some point (I think).

I'm not convinced; I somewhat expect that we will be able to keep it. Quotients by ideals are already defined in terms of `RingCon`, without any issue.
In that case I'll just withdraw my objection / concern. Thanks!

> With the `abbrev` approach, my thinking is that this would come mostly for free, but I'm concerned that using a `structure` will significantly complicate this.

What this *does* apply to is the lattice structure, but I think this is just a pile of boilerplate, and not a significant complication.
Can I gently nudge this PR in the direction of merging? perhaps @eric-wieser

maintainer merge

(just to be clear, I don't want to bors merge because this PR is written by a student of mine).
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.

:v: jjaassoonn can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9810540016/job/27090887332)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9810540016/job/27090887730)
bors d+
This now looks fine to me.
This now looks fine to me.
bors d+
Should it be `abbrev` or `def`, do we want Lean to unfold `TwoSidedIdeal`?
Definitely `abbrev` if we're going to have it at all, but I'll wait for other reviewers to comment about whether we actually want the alternate spelling.

I think having this alternate spelling is probably confusing; either we should have one name that functions both as a relation and a set, or we define
```lean
structure TwoSidedIdeal where
  toRingCon : RingCon R
```
to draw a clear distinction between the two APIs.
I am okay both ways, not to use a structure with a single field could save some boilerplate probably. But I don‚Äôt really mind boilerplate code.

We have `Module` meaning `VectorSpace` -- so we could have `RingCon` meaning `TwoSidedIdeal` but I'm not mad keen on the idea really (I have enough trouble telling undergraduates how to make vector spaces). I guess I'm in favour of the one-field structure with some comment that this is implemented in a surprising-to-mathematicians way (but who cares, the same is true for compactness), and then some boilerplate. I guess this means rewriting the entire PR.
Okay. I have switched to one-field-structure approach.
Since we are using a structure, might as well provide an alternative constructor

```suggestion

* `TwoSidedIdeal`: For any `NonUnitalNonAssocRing R`, `TwoSidedIdeal R` is the exactly `RingCon R`.
```

```suggestion
* `TwoSidedIdeal`: For any `NonUnitalNonAssocRing R`, `TwoSidedIdeal R` is a wrapper around `RingCon R`.
```

```suggestion
  `x ‚àà I` if and only if `I.ringCon x 0`.
```

I think you can move this up, just after the `neg_mem` lemma.
Then you can use it in theproofs of `sub_mem` and `nsmul_mem` etc...
Of course the current proofs are also one-liners, so this isn't very important.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/TwosidedIdeal/Basic): define two-sided-ideal

source.title: feat(RingTheory/Congruence): interpret `RingCon` as two sided ideals
